info.title: IT Collect
info.description:
The IT Dashboard team aims to build a modern API that acts as the center-piece of a modular IT data reporting ecosystem. This OpenAPI spec shows the initial direction of ITCollect data architecture and is aimed at providing real-time updates to the IT Collect API. It will serve as living documentation of the latest changes.

# Authentication

  • Project activity planned start date {{ start_date }} cannot be a date after planned completion date {{ end_date }}.
  • Project activity projected start date {{ start_date }} cannot be a date after projected completion date {{ end_date }}.
  • The field {{ field_name }} is a baselined field. A valid rebaseLineId is required to modify this field during PUT and PATCH operations.

agencyId.description:
A unique identifier for the document provided by the submitting user.
Validations
  • Property '{{ value }}' already exists in IT Collect. * Please use a different value.

activityName.description:
A short description consistent with the critical steps within the Agency project management methodology.
Validations
  • This value should not be blank.
  • One of the following Length errors:
    1) This value is too short. It should have {{ limit }} character or more.|This value is too short. It should have {{ limit }} characters or more..
    2) This value is too long. It should have {{ limit }} character or less.|This value is too long. It should have {{ limit }} characters or less..
    3) This value should have exactly {{ limit }} character.|This value should have exactly {{ limit }} characters..
    4) This value does not match the expected {{ charset }} charset..

description.example: Allow relevant users to access CPIC data
description.description:
Brief description of primary goal/outcome the activity is planning to provide for the Investment upon completion.
Validations
  • This value should not be blank.
  • One of the following Length errors:
    1) This value is too short. It should have {{ limit }} character or more.|This value is too short. It should have {{ limit }} characters or more..
    2) This value is too long. It should have {{ limit }} character or less.|This value is too long. It should have {{ limit }} characters or less..
    3) This value should have exactly {{ limit }} character.|This value should have exactly {{ limit }} characters..
    4) This value does not match the expected {{ charset }} charset..

plannedStartDate.description:
The planned start date (YYYY-MM-DD) for the activity. This is a baseline field.
Validations
  • This value should not be blank.
  • This value is not a valid date.
  • ActivityCompletionDate

plannedEndDate.description:
The planned completion date (YYYY-MM-DD) for the activity. This is a baseline field.
Validations
  • This value should not be blank.
  • This value is not a valid date.
  • ActivityCompletionDate

projectedStartDate.description:
If the activity has not yet started, enter the current projected start date (YYYY-MM-DD) of the activity.
Validations
  • This value should not be blank.
  • This value is not a valid date.
  • ActivityCompletionDate

projectedEndDate.description:
If the activity has not yet completed, enter the current planned completion date (YYYY-MM-DD) of the activity.
Validations
  • This value should not be blank.
  • This value is not a valid date.
  • ActivityCompletionDate

actualStartDate.description:
When the activity starts, enter the actual start date (YYYY-MM-DD) here.
Validations
  • This value should not be blank.
  • This value is not a valid date.
  • ActivityCompletionDate

actualEndDate.description:
When the activity ends, enter the actual completion date (YYYY-MM-DD) here.
Validations
  • This value should not be blank.
  • This value is not a valid date.
  • ActivityCompletionDate

plannedTotalCost.description:
The planned total cost for the activity. [$M] Note: For programs that are employing earned value management, Agencies should reflect "budget at completion" in the "Total Costs Planned" Column 11 and "estimated at completion" in the "Total Costs Projected" Column 12. This is a baseline field.
Validations
  • This value should not be blank.
  • This value should be positive.

actualTotalCost.description: When the activity ends, enter the total actual costs for the activity here.

projectedTotalCost.description:
if the activity is not yet completed, enter the current planned total cost of the activity. [$M] Note: For programs that are employing earned value management, Agencies should reflect "budget at completion" in the "Total Costs Planned" Column 11 and estimated at completion in the "Total Costs Projected" Column 12.
Validations
  • This value should not be blank.
  • This value should be positive.

structureId.description:
Agency-specified identifier that indicates the work breakdown structure (WBS) the Agency uses to associate the activity with other activities or a project. Provide this in the format of "x.x.x.x.x" where the first string is the Unique Project ID and each following string (separated by periods) matches the structure ID of a parent activity. See below for more guidance about parent and child activities expressed through this structure. [x.x.x.x.x]
Validations
  • Property '{{ value }}' already exists in IT Collect. Please use a different value.
  • This value should not be blank.
  • The structureId, {{ structureId }} you have provided does not contain a valid {{ missingValue }}. Please provide a proper value

rebaseLineId.description:
Baseline fields include: - plannedStartDate - plannedEndDate - plannedEndDate A valid rebaseLineId is required if your are modifying baseline fields.
Validations
  • The rebaseLineId you submitted is invalid: {{rebaseLineId}}. A rebaseLineId must exist and be associated with your agency: {{agency_code}}

PIID.description:
The unique identifier for each contract, agreement, or order associated with this
Investment (Federal Procurement Data Systems (FPDS) data element 1A).
Enter PIID numbers for contacts, agreements, or orders both that have already been awarded.
Completed and/or expired contracts do not need to be included.
Data definitions can be found at Federal Procurement Data System.
Please note that reference PIIDs should not be entered for this field.

referencePIID.description:
For each PIID number reported for contract support obtained via an order or call,
report the Reference PIID per FPDS instructions for element 1c.

type.description:
Select either O&M or DME.
O&M: Operations & Maintenance Costs refers to the expenses required to operate and maintain an IT asset that is operating in a production environment.
DME: Development, Modernization, and Enhancement refers to projects and activities leading to new IT assets/systems, as well as projects and activities that change or modify existing IT assets to substantively improve capability or performance, implement legislative or regulatory requirements, or meet an Agency leadership request. DME activity may occur at any time during a programs life cycle.

Appendix B.
- 48: Any Multi-Agency (Inter- or Intra-Agency) IT collaboration or an individual Agencys participation
in one of these initiatives, such as use of a centralized FOIA portal.

sharedServiceId.description:
Shared Services Identifier - 4 digits
These four digits are applicable for all Investments with a Shared Services Category of 24 or 48. A code will be
specifically assigned for all E-Gov/LoB shared services in Appendix B, while Agencies should assign their own
four digit unique codes for Multi-Agency initiatives using the 48 shared services category.

This code represents the same 4-digit identifier previously provided in the last nine digits of the UII for
Investments starting with xxx-99999XXXX.

missionSupportCategory.description:
Mission Support Category - 2 digit code - 01, 02, 03, 04, 05, 06, or 07
These two digits indicate the category of common Mission Support Services
Investments by Federal Integrated Business Framework (FIBF) Service Area(s).
All non-Mission Support Services Investments should use Category 01. Mission
Support Services Investments may select more than one code where applicable:

- 01: Not Applicable
- 02: Financial Management
- 03: Human Resources
- 04: Procurement
- 05: Travel / Transportation
- 06: Grants Management
- 07: Other

bureauCode.description:
Bureau Code (string) - 2 digit code
The two digits indicate the bureau code of the Investment (see Appendix C of OMB Circular No. A-11).
If this is a department-level or an Agency-wide  activity, use 00 as your bureau code.

partOfAITPS.description:
Part of AITPS (string) - 2 digit code - 01, 02, or 03
These two digits indicate one of the three parts of the Agency IT Portfolio
Summary, to which the Investment belongs:

- 01: Part 1. IT Investments for Mission Delivery
- 02: Part 2. IT Investments for Mission Support Services
- 03: Part 3. IT Investments for IT Infrastructure, IT Security, and IT Management

standardIdCategory.description:
Standard IT Infrastructure and Management Category
2 digit code - 01, 02, 03, 04, 05, 06, 07 ,08, 09, or 10
These two digits indicate the sub-category of Investments identified as Part 3:
IT Investments for IT Infrastructure, IT Security, and IT Management. For the
FY 2021 reporting cycle, the four previous optional Standard Investments
Output, Application, Delivery, and Platform will now be required.

All Part 3 Investments should select one of the following codes other than 01: Not
Applicable, while all Part 1 and 2 Investments should select 01: Not Applicable.

- 01: Not Applicable
- 02: IT Security and Compliance
- 03: IT Management
- 04: Network
- 05: Data Center and Cloud
- 06: End User
- 07: Output
- 08: Application
- 09: Delivery
- 10: Platform

missionSupportArea.description:
Mission Delivery and Management Support Area  - 2 digit code
These two digits indicate the mission delivery and management support areas.
Agencies should assign a unique code for each mission delivery and
management support area reported.

investmentType.description:
Type of Investment - 2 digit code - 01, 02, 03, 04, or 05
These two digits indicate the type of Investment being reported as follows:

- 01: Major IT Investments
- 02: Non-major IT Investments
- 03: IT Migration Investment: The portion of a larger asset and for which there is an existing Business Case
for the overall asset. The description of the IT Investment should indicate the UII of the major asset Investment
of the managing partner.
- 04: Funding Transfer Investments: These are primarily used to indicate the partner contribution to a Lead
Agency Investment through inter- or intraAgency transfers. The description of the IT Investment should indicate
the UII of the Lead Agencys Investment.
- 05: Standard IT Infrastructure Investments in Part 3: IT Infrastructure, IT  Security, IT Management
Investments (IT Security and Compliance, IT Management, Network, Data Center and Cloud, End User, Output,
Application, Delivery, and Platform).

returnOnInvestment.example: Sample description of a return on an investment.

nssId.description:
National Security Systems Identifier - 2 digit code - 01 or 02
These two digits indicate whether the Investment is a National Security System the Federal Information Security
Management Act of 2002 (FISMA), 44 U.S.C. 3542(b)(2) as follows:

- 01: Non-National Security System Investment
- 02: National Security System Investment (these investments will not be publicly viewable on the IT Dashboard)

publicUrls.description:
Public URL(s) List any website or digital service that is supported primarily by this Investment.
Supply an array of strings (URLS).

serviceArea.description:
Primary service area (string) - 3 digit code
This is the three digit code that indicates the predominant business function
served by the Investment (not necessarily the Agencys mission/business).
BRM version 3.1 contains the current mapping codes.

oauth.description:
IT Collect will utilize the OAuth2 Authorization framework to authenticate vendor client
applications to start using our APIs. A walkthrough of client configuration for Postman is
outlined below. All current documentation and application features are currently undergoing
development.

As part of your vendor application you will need to authenticate via an OAuth 2.0 compatible
client library using the Authorization Code Grant Type. Once a token is received from the
IT Collect OAuth server it will need to be included as part of an HTTP Request Header for
subsequent requests to API endpoints. CURL Example:

```console
curl -X GET "http://itcollect-url-tbd/v1/services"  -H  "Authorization: Bearer YOUR-TOKEN-HERE" -H  "accept: application/ld+json"
```

## Prerequisites
- Request an OAuth 2 identifer and secret from IT Collect team.
- Request a sandbox user account.
- Provider IT Collect with an OAuth 2.0 compatible callback URL

## Postman

[Postman](https://www.postman.com/) is an API Client that you can use for communication
with IT Collect.

### Vendor Steps

1. Create a new Postman Collection and import the OpenAPI spec

2. Edit the Collection

3. Switch to the Authorization tab and select `OAuth 2.0`

4. Click the "Get New Access Token" button leaving Header Prefix as `Bearer`.

| Setting | Value |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| Token Name | Bearer |
| Grant Type | Authorization Code |
| * Callback URL | https://app.getpostman.com/oauth2/callback |
| * Authorize using browser | Yes, enable this option |
| Auth URL (TBD) | http://dev-itcollect.domain/admin/authorize |
| Access Token URL (TBD) | http://dev-itcollect.domain/admin/token |
| Client ID | *{Request from IT Collect}* |
| Client Secret | *{Request from IT Collect}* |
| * State |  |
| Client Authentication | Send client credentials in body |

> * Callback URL: Vendor application callback URL.  Will depend on individual vendor
implementation.  Must be provided to IT Collect team prior to implementation.
> * Authorize using browser: This option is specific to PostMan and is required for PIV
cards to be used by Login.gov. PostMan cannot read PIVs so a browser is required for this
step.
> * State: This is an optional parameter, leave blank in Postman, but you may provide a
state in your vendor application. You may use this as CSRF protection mechanism or to
assist in maintaining a state such as a session key.

5. Click "Request Token"

6. Login using either your sandbox user account or your login.gov account (see below).

You should now have an access token suitable for defining the HTTP Authorization Header.

#### Login.gov PIV card

PIV (Personal Identity Verification) cards testing steps

1. Once the browser window has opened (you may need to allow popups in your browse for this
domain) click "Login with Login.gov"

2. Provide your Login.gov credentials using either your PIV access card or username and
password credentials.

You should now have an access token suitable for defining in the HTTP Authorization Header.
